title: Sri Lanka bond yields rise, indicative dollar at Rs.229.5
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields closed rose in dull trade while treasuries yields moved up across maturities at Wednesday’s auction, dealers said.
The debt office offered 20 billion rupees of 3-month bills and sold 59.3 billion rupees.
The debt office offered and sold 60 billion rupees of bills.
In debt markets, a bond maturing on 01/08/2025 closed at  13.00/20 percent on Wednesday (9), up from  13.00/13.10  percent, on Tuesday.
The three months’ bill closed at 10.35/50 percent, up from 9.80/10.00   per cent.
Sri Lanka’s rupee was quoted 240/255 per US dollar in late afternoon trade, hours after the central bank chief at a meeting with bankers confirmed that the currency is floating.
The average buying rate for telegraphic transfers at banks was 225.2013 and the selling rate was 229.9987.
The central bank’s indicative spot rate on Tuesday (08) was 229.5 up from 202.0909 on Wednesday (09). (Colombo/March 09/2022)
